Message.Title: Choke on this libs, Harry Reid personally inserted in the Obamacare law an directive that guns are NOT reportable by the medical profession
Message.Msg: Looks like Obama should have read the "Obamacare" law before he signed it, OR he was so eager to get "Obamacare" that he didn't care about the "gun owners" clause that was in it! So, Obama was either stupid for not reading the bill OR knew the clause was necessary to get his "Obamacare" passed, so that his ego could soar! Wednesday, it was discovered that hidden deep within the massive 2800-page bill called Obamacare, there is a Senate Amendment protecting the right to keep and bear arms. It seems that in their haste to cram socialized medicine down the throats of the American people, then-Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D CA) and Barack Obama overlooked Senate amendment 3276, Sec. 2716, part c. According to that amendment, the government cannot collect "any information relating to the lawful ownership or possession of a firearm or ammunition." This means that the government CANNOT mandate firearm registration. No registration, no confiscation. Poor ol' Joe Biden, he spent the last couple of weeks focusing on making a law requiring registration. Good thing is though, the amendment also states that not even an executive order can override the amendment. CNN is now referring to it as "a gift to the nation's powerful gun lobby."And according to Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-NV), that's exactly right. He says he personally added the provision in order to keep the NRA from getting involved in the legislative fight over Obamacare, which was so ubiquitous in 2010.

Message.Title: 5 Reasons Jeb Bush will not, never ever be president.
Message.Msg: 1. George Herbert Walker Bush 2. George Walker Bush 3. Jeb Stuart Bush 4. The "defunct" Republican Party 5. The USA is not a Kingdom and we are not serfs or subjects

Message.Title: Boehner quote Nov 19, 2012
Message.Msg: "There are a lot of special-interest loopholes in the tax code, both corporate and personal," said House Speaker John Boehner, R-Ohio. "There are all kinds of deductions, some of which make sense, others don't." Boehner said limiting or ending those unproductive tax breaks could boost growth and raise revenue.

Topic.Title: SOON MINORITIES WILL WANT TO IMPRISON ALL WHITES AND SEIZE THEIR PROPERTY FOR HISTORIC CRIMES AGAINST THEM

Message.Msg: Barack has created and identified so many different victim affiliations, I think the civil war will be between them to determine who has priority to steal from those of us (regardless of color) who have something worth stealing. Once that's done, a la too many countries to name in Africa, then the place will go to rot. The one thing the takers never count on, though, is that the makers can make - whatever it is that they make - anywhere, and are more likely to do the making where the taking isn't. So as a taker you get to steal once, and then you get to starve in the rat-infested hellhole of your making. But only once.

Topic.Title: Boehner quote Nov 19, 2012

Message.Msg: Sure....but you got to go through whatever lobbyists and the state's congressmen with their NIMBY attitude. We'd get a better handle on our war expenses if whatever congressmen were affected didn't jump up squalling not to lose business. someone put up a list of frills we could dispense with....but nooooo.....Obama's WH wanted the sequester. And in all fairness, it's a problem of both parties. Of course Obama'd be happiest to keep it all and keep raising taxes.

Topic.Title: Boehner quote Nov 19, 2012

Message.Msg: Thanks for making the conservative point, Liberty. What he said is that lowering the tax rates and closing the loop holes would drive additional revenue growth. And the IRS record proves it, conclusively. Higher tax rates = lower revenues. Lower taxes = higher revenues. You tax something, you get less of it. The great story of tarrifs. Strange that no economist will argue that taxing imports prevents imports, because they know that is so. But when we talk about taxing income, suddenly it becomes a political battlefield where the laws of physics and common sense are suspended for liberals. When you tax income, you get less of it. The higher you tax it, the less of it you get. Simple. True. Irrefutable. Thanks for making the point. Good post.

Topic.Title: 5 Reasons Jeb Bush will not, never ever be president.

Message.Msg: Interesting double-negative. If I follow you, Reggie, Jeb Bush would actually be president. I personally think that would be a bad thing. For everybody. Obama is the best thing that has happened to conservatives. He is accelerating the decline and demonstrating the failure of liberalism. In his quixotic desire to implement every policy of destruction that liberalism embodies, he will destroy his vary supporters and convert their survivors for generations to conservatism. Not people like you, mind you. The too-far-gone will be of no use in the post-Obama world. Unable to work or even know what the word means, all the food stamp money gone, nobody to protect you from the hordes of lawless who didn't turn in their guns when you willingly accepted the edict and surrendered your freedom and self-protection. You'll be dialing 911 while the thieves are slitting your throat or putting holes in your back, an asterisk on the way back to a free society, worthy of mention in future history books, but only to serve as a warning to others; an example of what not to do, a pristine illustration of how emotion and common sense practicality do not exist as forces in unison, but instead form a cacophony. And in the end, history will read that you chose poorly.

Topic.Title: Boehner quote Nov 19, 2012

Message.Msg: You need to check the results of Regan tax cuts and added taxes. Also look at growth and revenue and taxes during Clinton. The point on Boehner is those loopholes are still there, lets close them if they make sense. Your supply side economics are a failed myth. Taxes were cut and replaced with deficit spending which stimulates the economy by kicking the can down the road. That is what both Bush and Reagan did. Take your theory to the extreme, No taxes then should create the greatest government revenue. No one will argue that would be true. Lower is not always better, There is a place where the lines cross that is optimum. Next is the question of where the taxes should come from. Right now we are trying to run a 21 century country on a 20th century budget because no one paid the bills for the last 30 years. Take away the debt created by either Reagan or Bush and we would not have a problem right now. Just look at the debt service they saddled the present government with during times that were supposedly prosperous.

Topic.Title: Boehner quote Nov 19, 2012

Message.Msg: "someone put up a list of frills we could dispense with....but nooooo.....Obama's WH wanted the sequester." Do you think you could be more specific? By the way, spending bills are suppose to start in the house not the white house. The presidents job is to sign or veto. Obama has traveled allover the county trying to get people to pressure their reps not to let sequester happen. Pretty hard to say he wanted it. It was originally presented as a plan so bad that it would force Congress to get off their butts and do something.

Message.Title: Yahoo to close Message Boards
Message.Msg: Google: Yahoo killing Message Boards, BlackBerry app, and more in an attempt to 'sharpen focus' An excerpt: Yahoo will cull a number of its products over the coming months in an effort to sharpen its focus on its more important assets. On April 1st, Message Boards, Avatars, Sports IQ, Clues, and the Yahoo app for BlackBerry devices will all be shut down, although some parts of the services will continue operating. Yahoo's Finance and Fantasy Sports Message Boards will live on, and although it will no longer be updated or officially supported, users with the Yahoo BlackBerry app already installed will be able to continue using it....
